name: Treebones Resort

reviews.title: Highlight of our trip to Big Sur
reviews.text: The attention to detail at the resort is amazing, from koi pond to the swing to relax in. My husband and myself were in aww the whole stay. The lodge is fully equipped with a shop that has anything you could need and the restaurant is fantastic. The staff there is amazing and it almost has a family feel. But above all that the views are great and the Yurts are beautiful. Out of a 12 day vacation and 5 different resorts they had the most comfortable beds by far.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've had my eye on this resort for, literally, YEARS, and was just recently able to make the timing and reservation happen. So glad we did!!! What a fun concept, yurts along the California coast with fantastic views, fresh air, and the Pacific Ocean to feast your eyes upon. Just what we needed.
reviews.title: Serene and cozy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're interested in the "idea" of camping, but don't really want to camp, then this is a perfect option. You have the comfort of a queen sized bed, an in-room sink, table and chairs and a sofa to relax on, not to mention the Adirondack chairs on your deck for lazing about and soaking in some sun. You will have to use a communal bathroom for toilets and showers, but they were kept neat as a pin, supplied with body wash and hair dryers. Depending on your yurt location, you may have a bit of a walk. Neither my husband or myself experienced waiting times for toilets or showers, which was nice, even though the resort was fully booked.
reviews.title: Nice, original...but cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was super nice, in fact EVERYONE was super nice. We were given a printed sheet that had local trails nearby, which was appreciated and handy to have.
reviews.title: So Unique, So Wonderful
Yurting is the Best
reviews.text: Free breakfast, freshly made waffles (that you make!) are excellent, the homemade granola is delicious, fresh eggs each morning, toast, juice, yogurt...you decide, it's all great!! The owner happened to be in the dining room and gave me the great hint to put my plate and butter on top of the waffle maker to warm up both, brilliant! :-)

We were advised to stay at Treebones by Irish friend and we simply loved the place. Very comfortable and spacious Yurts in the middle of the nature. Our yurt even had a ping pong table. We shared a yoga practice early in the morning with the friendly staff and some guests.
reviews.title: Different resort close to nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is nice but a little expensive. A great place to stay with friends and children!
reviews.title: My new happy place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had to write and share our trip to treebones. It literally was an absolute dream. We had yurt #9- personally, I think its the best yurt of the bunch. we had magestic views and romantic, relaxing and enjoyable evening. They had great vegetarian options and even packed us a YUMMY lunch before we went hiking...we literally ate the yummiest sandwich next to a waterfall. this place was a dream.
reviews.title: Amazing resort in an amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Treebones Resort is the perfect place to enjoy the nature and beauty of Big Sur without actually camping (although you can bring a tent and use one of their camping lots if that’s your style). We called just a day or so before we arrived, and although the yurts were full, they offered us the newly opened treehouse. Tucked off to the edge of property, the tiny treehouse overlooks trees, hills, and beach, all the way to the ocean. This isn’t a place where you spend too much time in your room - although it’s certainly comfortable, with a bed, two chairs, a small gas fireplace (We used it! It was a little chilly in March!), and a very small sink - but Big Sur is a place you want to be outside enjoying. The views from the hotel, and getting to and from it on route one are unforgettable. Clean and well-kept bathrooms are just a short walk away (yes, bathrooms are shared), and the common dining room/living room is in a large, beautiful, spacious yurt, less than a 5-minute walk from the treehouse.
reviews.title: Unreal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like places that immerse you in nature, and minimize their footprint (off the grid, don’t clean your room unless you ask, quiet after 11pm), Treebones is the place for you.
reviews.title: A real gem on the Big sur coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed with this place from my first email enquiry. They have a two night min stay and I only wanted one but as they have an availability calendar online i could see they happened to have a one night gap when i wanted to stay- chanced my arm with an enquiry and appreciated their flexibility - result for everyone. The yurt was huge (too big to be cosy?) and the bed was superbly comfy. We were badly let down by the weather or had unrealistic expectations. I had done a minimal amount of research and expected it to be warm and sunny in September. Well it was cold, drizzly and so misty you couldn't see the sea despite being right next to it. So the whole paying more than my budget really allowed to have a place with a view and a pool didn't pay off. Pity as it left the experience feeling a bit flat - worth others knowing I reckon but no complaints about Treebones. It was a relaxing experience and we felt very well looked after. All the facilities were v clean and good and the hot tub was excellent - a perfect way to experience the outdoors on a grey day!
reviews.title: lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent Memorial Day weekend at Treebones with my girlfriend, as a late birthday present. The yurts were really neat, clustered around the restaurant, store and communal bathrooms. Each yurt has a comfy bed, heater and sink, and one can modify the temp inside by cracking open the dome on the roof. The sushi was fantastic, and Johnny the waiter incredibly friendly and helpful. The Wild Coast roll is not to be missed! The lodge has a nice fireplace for the evening when it gets chilly, and a heated pool and hot tub for apres hike relaxing. Sunday a great little band played for a few hours on the stage out in front of the lodge. All the staff were friendly and accomodating and helpful in recommending hikes.
reviews.title: off the grid in south big Sur

reviews.text: The downsides: it was a bit expensive for the lack of amenities, but you are way down the coast in the middle of all the hiking and scenery. Having to get dressed in the middle of the night to walk up to the bathroom was not exciting. The yurts were a bit close together for privacy, so you could hear the couples next door. Wifi was not too useful.
reviews.title: A very special place... and...

reviews.text: Overall a really neat spot, for those who want to be off the grid for awhile. You can plan your hikes north or south to see some really neat spot, lunch somewhere, then hike/sightsee for the afternoon, then get back and hot tub those stiff legs for a bit before grabbing some great sushi. The Big Daddy IPA on tap was delicious after a long day.
reviews.title: The Yurt experience of a lifetime!

reviews.text: We were very very excited to come and stay here, and it is a truly special place. First the good - location is supreme, of course. The pool and hot tub - a real blessing! The sushi was very good and a lot of fun - and naturally very pricy, but you're paying for the location! The bed was VERY comfortable, and it's a good thing the bedding was so warm, because the room was very cold! Definitely appreciated having a sink in the room with drinking water! The little shop is really nice for gifts, snacks and souvenirs. Very nice to get to walk in the garden, too, although I had a strong impulse to get my pruners out and do some maintenance - I've never seen Chard as tall as I am ;-) Overall, I'm afraid I'm perhaps getting too old for not having a bathroom very close by, and the shared showers could be roomier and better equipped for space to put your stuff, etc. I'm not sure there was really enough difference between the yurt and camping to justify the price for me... even though the yurts are nicely appointed, the sounds of the constant flapping of the canvas in the wind was pretty annoying.
reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Wait!
Overall great experience except for....
reviews.text: Wow..where should I start? Overall the experience was wonderful.. Except for 1 MAJOR NEGATIVE POINT. I almost gave this place 3 stars because of it. But we did truly enjoy our stay, which is why I gave it 4 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MAJOR NEGATIVE POINT!!-We stayed in the nest, which was amazing. I highly recommend staying there. However, my boyfriend and I felt like we were animals in a cage at the zoo because none of the others guests respected the PRIVACY signs clearly posted on the fence surrounding the nest. We stayed a total of 3 days/2 nights..each day at least 3 or 4 different couples asked us about the nest and a few couples even tried hopping the fence to take pictures of the nest while we were IN THE NEST!!! The first night I fell asleep early, My boyfriend stayed up to read his magazine. This couple hopped the fence and walked over to the nest, it wasn't until they saw my boyfriend that they apologized. This happened on a DAILY basis..a few couples apologized but majority didn't. We would leave our belongings in the nest while we were hiking during the day (because there was no where else to put our clothes, etc)... it makes me wonder if the other guests would go thru our stuff. When we checked out, we told the hotel staff. Our concern was quickly dismissed. The hotel staff said it was "human nature" to be curious..REALLY?? We didn't go to their yurt to take pictures of where they slept. So why should they be allowed to take pictures of where we slept..while we're still sleeping!! As we were packing up our vehicle..the "vultures" noticed we were packing up to leave and ran over to take pictures in the nest..Wow..very classless....
reviews.title: Unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Postives-The overall "glamping" experience was nice. I've travelled all over the world...but this was my first camping trip. The staff was great (except for the response when we checked out), the food was amazing, and the restrooms/showers were nice. The restaurants were really good too.
reviews.title: 5 years of waiting paid off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend staying here and reserving the nest...but be prepared to feel like an animal at the zoo! Because apparently it's "human nature" to be curious!
reviews.title: AB-SO-LUTELY AMAZING!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Treebones Resort only one night, but did not want to leave the property! We rented the yurt with full-ocean view and a fireplace. What a nice romantic accommodation! After driving there, we got to hot Jacuzzi and watched the sunset with other guests, relaxing our tired bodies. Then we went to the lodge and enjoyed a fireplace there with a glass of wine prior to our dinner. We ordered a Moroccan dish which was delicious. In the morning, we cooked our breakfast (pancakes) and ate it outside under sunshine. During our breakfast, we saw many dolphins having their breakfast in the ocean. It was amazing experience! We are dreaming to come back there again!
reviews.title: Not for everybody, but for the right people, wow.

description: Unusual and unique eco-lodge experience with immense and expansive ocean views on Big Sur's remote and rugged south coast. Guests enjoy cozy comforts in fully furnished tent-like yurts or choose a campsite and bring all their own tents/gear to camp. Resort 'feel' in rustic setting. Two popular restaurant venues with cozy, communal atmosphere boast great service, organic, locally sustained cuisine with same great views. Massage services, hiking information, and modern book & sundries store on premises.
